panels.description:
Alert history for _**$ic**_.

* *green* - not firing
* *yellow* - firing, `severity="info"`
* *orange* - firing, `severity="ticket"`
* *red* - firing, `severity="page"`

targets.expr:
label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
sum without (severity, alertstate) (
  max_over_time(ALERTS{ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance",alertstate="firing",severity="page"}[$__interval]) * 3
    or on (job, ic, alertname, alertstate)
  max_over_time(ALERTS{ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance",alertstate="firing",severity="ticket"}[$__interval]) * 2
    or on (job, ic, alertname, alertstate)
  max_over_time(ALERTS{ic="$ic",ic_subnet=~"$ic_subnet",instance=~"$instance",alertstate="firing",severity="info"}[$__interval]) * 1
),
"__name__", "$1 ", "alertname", "(.*)"),
"alertname", "", "alertname", ".*"),
"ic", "", "ic", ".*"),
"ic_subnet", "$1", "ic_subnet", "([a-z0-9]+)-.*"),
"ic_node", "$1", "ic_node", "([a-z0-9]+)-.*"),
"instance", "$1...$2", "instance", "(\\[[^.:]+[.:]).*([.:][^.:]+\\]?:[0-9]+)")

label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
label_replace(
sum without (severity, alertstate) (
  max_over_time(ALERTS{ic="$ic",instance=~"($instance_host).*",instance!~".*:9090",alertstate="firing",severity="page"}[$__interval]) * 3
    or on (job, ic, alertname, alertstate)
  max_over_time(ALERTS{ic="$ic",instance=~"($instance_host).*",instance!~".*:9090",alertstate="firing",severity="ticket"}[$__interval]) * 2
    or on (job, ic, alertname, alertstate)
  max_over_time(ALERTS{ic="$ic",instance=~"($instance_host).*",instance!~".*:9090",alertstate="firing",severity="info"}[$__interval]) * 1
),
"__name__", "$1 ", "alertname", "(.*)"),
"alertname", "", "alertname", ".*"),
"ic", "", "ic", ".*"),
"ic_subnet", "$1", "ic_subnet", "([a-z0-9]+)-.*"),
"ic_node", "$1", "ic_node", "([a-z0-9]+)-.*"),
"instance", "$1...$2", "instance", "(\\[[^.:]+[.:]).*([.:][^.:]+\\]?:[0-9]+)")

panels.title: IC Alerts

panels.description:
Memory stack, mean across nodes:

 * Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
 * PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
 * SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
 * Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
 * Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
 * Buffers - Block device (e.g. harddisk) cache
 * Unused - Free memory unassigned
 * Swap - Swap space used
 * Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
panels.title: Mean Node Memory Stack

panels.description:
Active / inactive memory, median across nodes:

 * Inactive file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
 * Inactive anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
 * Active file - File-backed memory on active LRU list
 * Active anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs
panels.title: Median Node Memory Active / Inactive

panels.description: Distribution of overall CPU usage, per node.
panels.title: Node CPU Usage Distribution

panels.description: Available disk space, per node. The dotted line is the total disk size.
panels.title: Node Available Disk Space

panels.description: Mean read and write operations and read and written bytes, across nodes.
panels.title: Mean Node Disk Reads/Writes

panels.description: Mean concurrent I/O operations, per node.
panels.title: Node Concurrent I/O operations

panels.description:
Mean I/O usage and [pressure](https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/accounting/psi.html), across nodes.

* **I/O Usage**: percentage of time that at least one I/O operation was in progress
* **Stalled (All)**: percentage of time that all non-idle tasks were stalled on I/O
* **Stalled (Some)**: percentage of time that some non-idle tasks were stalled on I/O
panels.title: Mean Node I/O Usage and Pressure

panels.description: Mean RX/TX packets and bytes, across nodes.
panels.title: Mean Node Network Traffic

panels.description: Mean TCP connections in use and created per second, across nodes.
panels.title: Mean Node TCP Connections
